headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Authorized access token. For details, see Authentication .

parameters.name: custom_audience_id Conditional
parameters.description: You need pass in either locations or custom_audience_id in the request. Custom audience ID. Note : When custom_audience_id is specified, either selected_audience or locations cannot be used. Otherwise, an error will occur. The audience ID you input must belong to your specified advertisers.

parameters.name: locations Conditional
parameters.description: You need pass in either locations or custom_audience_id in the request. Locations. Max size : 5 Note : When locations is specified, custom_audience_id cannot be used. Otherwise, an error will occur.

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description: Country code. See Appendix-Location IDs for details.

parameters.name: location_ids
parameters.description: Location IDs. By default, all location IDs under the specified country code are selected. The location IDs you input must fall within the range of the specified country code.

parameters.name: dimensions
parameters.description: Use this field to control which API response dimensions are returned. Enum values: age , gender , country , top_regions , operating_system , operating_system_version , device_price , top_interests , bottom_interests , engagement , ad_interest_categories , and top_hashtags . Note : Currently, you can input only one dimension for each API call.

parameters.name: selected_audience
parameters.description: The audience you want to filter for.

parameters.name: top_regions_country_code Conditional
parameters.description: Required if you have input top_regions in the dimensions field and specified locations . When the dimension is top_regions , the corresponding return fields will contain the sub-regions within the country you specified in locations .

parameters.name: languages
parameters.description: Codes of the languages that you want to target. For the list of language codes supported, see Enumeration - Language Code . You can also get language codes via /tool/language/ .

parameters.name: age_groups
parameters.description: Age groups you want to target. For enum values, see Enumeration - Age Group .

parameters.name: gender
parameters.description: Genders that you want to target. Enum values: GENDER_FEMALE , GENDER_MALE . If you don't pass anything, it means that you want to target both males and females.

parameters.name: device_price_ranges
parameters.description: Targeting device price range. 10000 means 1000+. The numbers must be in multiples of 50.

parameters.name: min_ios_version
parameters.description: Minimum iOS version. For enum values, see Enumeration - Minimum iOS Version .

parameters.name: min_android_version
parameters.description: Minimum Android version. For enum values, see Enumeration - Minimum Android Version .

parameters.name: operating_systems Conditional
parameters.description: Required if you've specified either min_ios_version or min_android_version . Device operating systems that you want to target. Enum values: ANDROID , IOS . Only one value is allowed. If you don't pass anything, it means that you want to target both Android and iOS systems.

parameters.name: interest_category_ids
parameters.description: Interest classification. Use /tool/interest_category/ to get a list of available interest categories. Use /tool/target_recommend_tags/ to get a list of recommended interest categories.

parameters.name: video_action_category_ids
parameters.description: IDs of the video action categories. Use /tool/action_category/ to get a list of available video interaction categories ( action_scene = VIDEO_RELATED in the response). Use /tool/targeting_category/recommend/ to get a list of recommended video interaction categories ( scene = VIDEO_RELATED in the response).

parameters.name: creator_action_category_ids
parameters.description: IDs of the creator action categories. Use /tool/action_category/ to get a list of available creator interaction categories ( action_scene = CREATOR_RELATED in the response). Use /tool/targeting_category/recommend/ to get a list of recommended creator interaction categories ( scene = CREATOR_RELATED in the response).

parameters.name: hashtag_action_category_ids
parameters.description: Hashtag IDs. Use /tool/hashtag/recommend/ to get a list of recommended hashtag IDs, or use /tool/hashtag/get/ to get hashtags by IDs.
